concept.title: Enabling LZO and Snappy Compression
concept.shortdesc: To use LZO or Snappy compression with Hadoop FS, you need to enable the to use the compression type.

conbody.p:
LZO compressionenabling for Hadoop FSSnappy compressionenabling for Hadoop FSHadoop FS destinationenabling LZO or Snappy compressionThe steps to enable compression differ based on the compression type that you want to use them with:
Using Snappy with the Hadoop FS destination You can use Snappy with one version of Hadoop FS. To enable Snappy for Hadoop FS, perform the following steps:
Verify the location of the libsnappy.so file.
With the Hadoop installation, the libsnappy.so file is generally installed in the following directory: /usr/lib/hadoop/lib/native/.
If the file is not installed at this location, see the documentation for your Hadoop distribution for the location of the file or instructions on how to install the file. For details, see the documentation for your Hadoop distribution.If you have multiple versions of Hadoop FS installed, make sure to locate the file for the version you want to use.
In the environment file, set the Java system property java.library.path to the location of the Snappy native library. Add the property to the SDC_JAVA_OPTS environment variable as follows:-Djava.library.path=<path to Snappy native library>
For information about configuring the SDC_JAVA_OPTS environment variable, see .
In the destination, select the Snappy compression codec.
Using LZO with the Hadoop FS destination You can use LZO with one version of Hadoop FS. To enable LZO for Hadoop FS, perform the following steps:
If necessary, install the Hadoop LZO native library.
If you have multiple versions of Hadoop FS installed, make sure you install the version that you want to use. See the documentation for your Hadoop distribution for details.
In the environment file, set the Java system property java.library.path to the location of the LZO native library. Add the property to the SDC_JAVA_OPTS environment variable as follows:
-Djava.library.path=<path to LZO native library>For information about configuring the SDC_JAVA_OPTS environment variable, see .
In the destination, select the Other compression codec and enter the full LZO class name.
